intro: Tylophora albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered tylophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as India, Thailand, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Tylophora albiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
